thread.title: Reign forward Beverly Yanez voted NWSL Player of the Week
thread.title_full: Reign forward Beverly Yanez voted NWSL Player of the Week

author: Matt Pentz
title: Reign forward Beverly Yanez voted NWSL Player of the Week
text:
Reign forward Beverly Yanez voted NWSL Player of the Week Originally published July 28, 2015 at 8:00 pm By Matt Pentz Seattle Times staff reporter 
Seattle Reign FC forward Beverly Yanez has been named National Women’s Soccer League Player of the Week following a vote of the league’s media, it announced Tuesday in a release. 
Yanez scored a pair of second-half goals in quick succession to help lead the Reign to a 3-0 victory over rival Portland in front of a club-record crowd at Memorial Stadium on Sunday. The 27-year-old now ranks second in the NWSL in goals this season with eight, just one shy of Washington’s Crystal Dunn. 
Yanez is the third Reign player to be so honored so far this year, with teammates Megan Rapinoe and Jess Fishlock earning Player of the Week nods for weeks one and nine, respectively. 
First-place Seattle returns to action on Saturday in Boston against the Breakers. Matt Pentz : 206-464-3184 or mpentz@seattletimes.com ; on Twitter: @mattpentz . Matt Pentz covers Sounders FC, Reign FC, MLS and world soccer for The Seattle Times throughout the year.
